```python
from vpython import *

# Screen Settings
scene = canvas(width=700, height=400)

# Constants
g = 9.81  # acceleration due to gravity (m/s^2)
dt = 0.01  # time step

# Initial parameters
initial_height = 5  # initial height of the ball
initial_velocity = 10  # initial horizontal velocity of the ball

# Objects
ground = box(pos=vector(0, 0, 0), size=vector(20, 0.1, 10), color=color.green)
ball = sphere(pos=vector(0, initial_height, 0), radius=0.5, color=color.red)

# Initial state
ball.velocity = vector(initial_velocity, 0, 0)
ball.acceleration = vector(0, -g, 0)

# Animation loop
while True:
    rate(100)
    
    ball.pos += ball.velocity * dt
    ball.velocity += ball.acceleration * dt
    
    if ball.pos.y - ball.radius <= ground.pos.y:
        ball.velocity.y *= -1
``` 

This code sets up the screen with the specified dimensions and creates an animation to demonstrate the horizontal projectile motion experiment with the specified initial parameters. The ball moves horizontally with the given initial velocity and accelerates due to gravity. It bounces elastically upon hitting the ground. If the initial_height variable is updated, the animation will rerun with the new initial height value.
